content.question: The specific combination of motifs and style used in each Malagan object is partially determined by

choices.label: customary laws that transferred the ownership of each object’s design to its individual patron
rules enforced by Australian governors which regulated the production of Malagan objects
rules that prescribed the usage of certain colors and patterns based on the patron’s social status
customs that restricted the artist to the use of traditional designs that were specific to his family

content.answer: customary laws that transferred the ownership of each object’s design to its individual patron

topic.text: 9.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Pacific Art

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how and/or why context influences artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, and/or function in the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
